intro: Hedysarum iwawogii, commonly known as the Iwawogii milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodland or grassy areas and thrives in well-drained soils. Hedysarum iwawogii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies. Its seeds are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive appearance and adaptability.
